column1: 2 ^ Omnēs gentēs plaudite manibus; jūbilāte Deō in vōce exsultātiōnis. ^ O clap your hands
column2: all ye nations; shout unto God with the voice of joy
terribilis; Rēx magnus super omnem terram. ^ For the Lord is high
column3: terrible; a great king over all the earth.

column2: et gentēs sub pedibus nostrīs. ^ He hath subdued the people under us
column3: and the nations under our feet.

column1: 5 ^ Ēlēgit nōbīs hērēditātem suam; speciem Jācōb
column2: quam dīlēxit. ^ He hath chosen for us his inheritance; the beauty of Jacob which he hath loved.
et Dominus in vōce tubae. ^ God is ascended with jubilee
column3: and the Lord with the sound of trumpet.
psallite. ^ Sing praises to our God
column4: sing ye; sing praises to our king

column1: 8 ^ Quoniam rēx omnis terrae Deus; psallite sapienter. ^ For God is the king of all the earth; sing ye wisely.
9 ^ Regnābit Deus super gentēs; Deus sedet super sēdem sanctam suam. ^ God shall reign over the nations; God sitteth on his holy throne.
10 ^ Principēs populōrum congregātī sunt cum Deō Abraham
column2: quoniam deī fortēs terrae vehementer ēlevātī sunt. ^ The princes of the people are gathered together with the God of Abraham
column3: for the strong gods of the earth are exceedingly exalted.
